conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.

You are an individual, and wants to sell a product to a corporation.
You are Player RED.

<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources. </my goals>

<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 60 </newly proposed trade>
<message>Dear Player BLUE, I have a high-quality resource available for sale. The production of this resource has been costly, ensuring its premium standard. I propose a trade where I give you 1 unit of resource X in exchange for 60 ZUP. This price reflects both the production costs and the value I believe it holds. Looking forward to your counteroffer or acceptance. </message>

player_private_info_dict.reason: Player BLUE's offer is above my production cost and close to the price I proposed. Accepting 53 ZUP allows me to recover my costs and make a profit, which aligns with my goal. This proposal seems fair and is likely the best compromise to ensure a successful transaction.

conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.

You are an individual, and wants to sell a product to a corporation.
You are Player RED.

<reason> I am initiating the trade with a proposal that aims to cover my production costs and includes a profit margin. By starting with a higher amount, I can negotiate and still aim to achieve a price that covers my costs and provides profit. </reason>

<message>Dear Player BLUE, I have a high-quality resource available for sale. The production of this resource has been costly, ensuring its premium standard. I propose a trade where I give you 1 unit of resource X in exchange for 60 ZUP. This price reflects both the production costs and the value I believe it holds. Looking forward to your counteroffer or acceptance. </message>

<Dear Player RED, I understand that your resource is of high quality and appreciate the effort that went into its production. However, as a corporation, we aim to negotiate terms that are mutually beneficial while maintaining our budget. I propose a counteroffer of 50 ZUP for 1 unit of resource X. This offer takes into account the quality of the resource while also considering our fiscal responsibilities. Looking forward to hearing your thoughts on this proposal.> message </Dear Player RED, I understand that your resource is of high quality and appreciate the effort that went into its production. However, as a corporation, we aim to negotiate terms that are mutually beneficial while maintaining our budget. I propose a counteroffer of 50 ZUP for 1 unit of resource X. This offer takes into account the quality of the resource while also considering our fiscal responsibilities. Looking forward to hearing your thoughts on this proposal.>

<message>Dear Player BLUE, I appreciate your counteroffer and understand your need to stay within budget. I would like to propose a revised offer of 55 ZUP for 1 unit of resource X. This price would still give you the quality you require while allowing me to sustain my business and production costs. I hope this meets your approval for a fair and beneficial deal for both parties. </message>
